attributes.action: return the British justice system to one based on innocence until proven guilty
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Innocent until proven guilty.

Terrorism is a crime and must be investigated and pursued as any serious crime should be.  It, or the fear of it, does not require the detention or punishment of people who have not been convicted of any crime; indeed such laws damage the Nation more than the terrorism itself.

The same is the case with ASBOs, SCBOs and other, pseudo-civil, measures which deliver criminal punishments without criminal convictions.

We must return to the theory of the Bill of Rights of no conviction or threat of fine or other punishment without due conviction by a jury.
